definition: to exhibit one's feelings in one's speech
to overflow/(literary) excessive/old variant of 鎰|镒[yi4]
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.chinese: 许多人都义愤填膺，溢于言表。

sentences.english: Seeing their son back, the boy's parents showed their gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 看到他们的儿子回来，小孩妁父母感激之情溢于言表。

sentences.english: His smile beamed and his happiness resonated.
sentences.chinese: 他愉快地笑着，幸福溢于言表。

sentences.english: And when the gates are opened, there He stands on the other side, and the affections are huge.
sentences.chinese: 当大门打开时，他站在门的那边，喜悦之情溢于言表。

sentences.english: Henry's guilt was scored across his face.

definition: to have one's heart filled with/(to collide) full on/(of farm animals) heavy with young
one's whole heart/from the bottom of one's heart
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to reveal (indirectly, implicitly)/to show (interest, contempt etc) by means of one's actions, tone of voice etc
face light up with delight (idiom); to beam with joy
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
